data.title: Capturing Content with Video: Webcasting and Screencasting
data.meta_description: Initial Setup To begin web recording within the Reflectivity web-based platform (not the Swivl Capture app) please ensure the following: ...
data.text:
1. When you click Record, a menu will open and the Webcam recording option is selected by default. Next, select the audio channel (which microphone do you want to use), and click Start Recording.

2. While recording, you can either pause or stop recording.

3. Finally, when you have finished recording and selected stop, you will have the opportunity to Retake or Upload. If you choose to upload your video, a pop-up will show you the uploading status, and it will load to the Reflectivity platform.*

NOTE: When you finish recording, hit "Save" and keep the webpage open until uploading is completed. If you have a large video or slower internet speed, you may need to adjust your computer settings so that the computer does not "go to sleep" before your video has been uploaded completely.

If you close your window or the computer goes to sleep before the video has been completely recorded, you will lose the recording.

Click Save. You can edit the title of the video, and add descriptions and tags.

!! Webcam recording can be used on devices that have a webcam.

When you Record, a menu will open and you can select Screen recording. Next, select the audio channel (which microphone you want to use), and click Share your screen.

Select what you would like to share and click Share. On the next page, click Start Recording.

While recording, you can either pause or stop recording.

Finally, when you have finished recording and selected stop, you will have the opportunity to Retake or Upload. If you choose to upload your video, a pop-up will show you the uploading status, and it will load to the Reflectivity platform.*

NOTE: When you finish recording, hit "Save" and keep the webpage open until uploading is completed. If you have a large video or slower internet speed, you may need to adjust your computer settings so that the computer does not "go to sleep" before your video has been uploaded completely.

If you close your window or the computer goes to sleep before the video has been completely recorded, you will lose the recording.

Click Save. You can edit the title of the video, and add descriptions and tags.

When you click Record, a menu will open and you can select Screen + Webcam. Next, select the audio channel (which microphone you want to use). The video channel is preselected for you. Now, click Share your screen.

Select what you would like to share and click Share. On the next page, click Start Recording.

While recording, you can either pause or stop recording.

Finally, when you have finished recording and selected stop, you will have the opportunity to Retake or Upload. If you choose to upload your video, a pop-up will show you the uploading status, and it will load to the Reflectivity platform.*

NOTE: When you finish recording, hit "Save" and keep the webpage open until uploading is completed. If you have a large video or slower internet speed, you may need to adjust your computer settings so that the computer does not "go to sleep" before your video has uploaded completely.

If you close your window or the computer goes to sleep before the video has been completely recorded, you will lose the recording.

Click Save. You can edit the title of the video, add descriptions and tags.

After the recording has been uploaded, you will have it displayed in the Videos on the Reflectivity platform as both:

a side-by-side video (video+screen)

and the screen recording with a circular webcam video in the bottom left corner (shown above).

If you have any issues accessing your camera, follow the following steps:

1. MacOS System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy tab > Camera/Microphone/Screen Recording and checkmark your browser (Google Chrome or Firefox are recommended) to allow access

Next steps are the following:

2. Click the lock icon in your URL line and select site settings:

Select Allow in the dropdown for Camera and for Microphone

3. If you see a message that Screen access is denied, follow these steps:

select Webcam recording

select your original choice; either Screen recording or Screen + Webcam

Important!

Please always make sure that the internet connection is stable and the network is not overloaded to avoid uploading issues.

Just in case, forward Swivl Firewall requirements to the school IT department so that they whitelist all necessary domains and ports.

If the video uploading has stopped or you see the error "Uploading failed":

Click on the "Download" button to save the encoded video file to your computer*.

When you have a stable internet connection, please upload the file to the Reflectivity platform to decode it to the video you need.

For more information about how to upload the video file from the computer, please check Uploading a Video From Computer

*To play the video file on your computer, please use VLC player (for Windows and macOS) and Media Player Classic (for Windows).

MacOS System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy tab > Camera/Microphone/Screen Recording and checkmark your browser (Google Chrome or Firefox are recommended) to allow access
